instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.Q9706: What is Q9706? Q9706 takes PPBUS_G3H's vltage and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q9706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R9788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q9706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Trolling me - Bad Keyboard? No backlight
threads.message:
Hello all, Today I Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is giving image, but no backlight
Client said they spilled tea on their computer (assuming kb) No liquid damage on board.

LVDS connector is good, fuse is good, not sure about cable as I don't have a spare one to try. But <SIGNAL>SW_0</SIGNAL> is 21v, so that wouldn't be enough to give me back light anyways...

<TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>
pin 4 - 12.56
pin 3 - 12.19
pin 1,2,5,6 0.04 and drops (without screen connected)

<TRANSISTOR>Q9707</TRANSISTOR>
pin 5 - 3.3v w/screen conn
pin 4 - 0v

<RESISTOR>R0901</RESISTOR> = 4.63k

<CHIP>U9600</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S0</SIGNAL> - 1.2V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> - 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_GMUX_R</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

<CHIP>U9701</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.12V
<SIGNAL>SW_0</SIGNAL> - 21v


Capslock button turns green for a moment, then back off

Anyone know what pins on J5713 I can short to act like the brightness up button before replacing kb? Unfortunately I do not have one in stock at the moment.

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Trolling me - Bad Keyboard? No backlight
threads.message: 21V means the PWM signal is probably not present. Do a PRAM reset with an external USB keyboard first. Disconnect internal keyboard and replace it when you get a new one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Trolling me - Bad Keyboard? No backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22969"]21V means the PWM signal is probably not present. Do a PRAM reset with an external USB keyboard first. Disconnect internal keyboard and replace it when you get a new one.[/QUOTE]

Thanks Duke! I didn't think about an external USB kb to try out. Worked like a charm, I have light now :) can the USB kb also be used for an SMC reset? I tried, but it didn't work for me.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Trolling me - Bad Keyboard? No backlight
threads.message: SMC reset is the same as removing all power, battery/charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Trolling me - Bad Keyboard? No backlight
threads.message: Double lessons learned! Thanks Duke. Do I mark this one as solved or does an admin?
